title: Roberto Firmino responds after Roy Keane slammed Man United and Liverpool players for tunnel actions
text:
Roberto Firmino has defended himself after Roy Keane criticised Liverpool and Manchester United players for 'hugging and kissing' in the tunnel before Sunday's game at Old Trafford.

Despite the fierce rivalry between the two clubs, Liverpool striker Firmino and his team-mate Fabinho were seen embracing United's Fred and Andreas Pereira in the tunnel, with all four players having played for Brazil.

Former United midfielder Keane, who attended the game as a pundit for Sky Sports, was left livid by the scenes, but Firmino stressed that it is 'normal' for players to greet each other before the game prior to facing each other as rivals.

Liverpool forward Roberto Firmino has defended himself following Roy Keane's criticism

Keane was livid at Firmino and others for 'hugging and kissing' in the tunnel at Old Trafford

Firmino told ESPN Brazil: 'I don't want to create controversy with anyone.

'I find it quite normal before the game to greet each other, ask how they are doing. That's all. Nothing more than that.

'But on the pitch, they aren't friends, each one defends his club to the best of his ability. Then the rivalry increases on the pitch.'

Keane, who was involved in an altercation with then Arsenal captain Patrick Vieira in the tunnel at Highbury in 2005, said that he was 'disgusted' with the scenes.

United's Brazilians Fred and Andreas Pereira embraced Firmino and Fabinho on Sunday

Keane said that he was 'disgusted' with the scenes between two sets of rival players

Keane added that 'the players have changed' as he criticised the scenes in the tunnel

He said on Sky Sports: 'I’m disgusted with players (scenes in the tunnel). You’re going to war, they’re hugging and kissing. Don’t even look at the opposition. You’re going into battle against them.

'The game hasn’t changed that much, the players have changed. You’re going to war against these players and they’re hugging each other. Chat to them after the game, or don’t even chat to them after the game.'

The clash between United and Liverpool ended in a 1-1 draw, with Marcus Rashford putting the hosts in front before substitute Adam Lallana scored a late equaliser for Jurgen Klopp's side.

Firmino and Liverpool are set to return to action on Wednesday night when they face Genk away in the Champions League.
description: Roberto Firmino has defended himself after Roy Keane criticised Liverpool and Manchester United players for 'hugging and kissing' in the tunnel before Sunday's game at Old Trafford.
